file_content.text: Pleasure doing business, stranger.
Ha. I bet Ezra you'd never come back. You just saddled me with a week's extra chores.
That's my husband, always looking on the bright side. Thank you for getting the power units.
Here, take the equipment we promised. I know you'll find it useful.
One of my easier paydays.
Certainly came back healthier than I would have.
Hope that I do or I'll be very unhappy.
I'd better.
That equipment ought to make you happier than an Evocii in bog slime.
My pleasure.
Excuse me, I need to go trade these power units for fresh supplies.
We don't want to trouble you any more, stranger. Thanks again.
You got those charged-up power units yet? We still need them.
Ezra, let me go. There isn't a scrap of food in the whole settlement!
How do you expect to do anything with that leg of yours?
It's not as bad as it looks, woman. Fa'athra's men won't get another shot at me.
That's the spirit! If at first you don't succeed, reload.
Thanks for your enthusiasm, stranger, but we're doing just fine here.
Fa'athra's men shot you?
Simple misunderstanding. Nothing to bother yourself with, stranger.
You get hurt out here?
It's nothing, stranger. I'm fine.
Don't be stupid, old man. You can barely stand.
Is this a suicide?
I just need to catch my breath.
Forgive my stubborn old fool of a husband. Getting shot in the leg has made him stupid.
I'm Ezra. This is Rand. We used to work the Rust Yards just like everyone else here--back when Nem'ro owned it.
Fa'athra took over and forced everyone out. Now we can't find work and we've run out of food.
Talk to him about it. He might help.
Go see Nem'ro.
Nem'ro couldn't care less about us.
That's awful.
On the plus side, the wife here's lost some weight since the food ran out.
Does this sob story have a point?
You're hungry. So what?
These people don't care about us, Ezra. Don't waste their time!
Don't bother this person with our problems, Ezra.
Shush, you old fool! We're starving to death, stranger. Rand has been stealing old power units from the Rust Yards to trade for food.
That's what he was doing when Fa'athra's men shot him. He barely made it back here alive.
Can't one of the other settlers give it a try?
Don't you have more people?
They don't know the Rust Yards like I do. They'd just get killed.
Is there some other way to get what you need?
Any other options?
If there was, do you think I'd be risking my hide?
You're pathetic.
I'm not too proud to beg, stranger.
My husband is in bad shape, but if you got some old power units, it would feed us for weeks.
That's not all we need, woman! The power units have to be recharged at the energy station--and that's the hard part!
What makes the energy station the hard part?
What's difficult about it?
Fa'athra has men guarding the area. Takes time to recharge the old units. That's how I got caught.
I see why you idiots are starving--your plan stinks.
What a half-baked scheme.
Wait, please. We... we can pay you. Not credits, but almost as good.
The power units must be worth something.
So don't recharge them.
People only trade food for energy they can use. Empty power units aren't worth spit.
Actually, we have other good equipment that we can't trade for food.
You bring us back enough recharged power units, and we'll give you everything we've got.
It's a deal. What do I have to do?
All right, I'm in.
No promises.
Head to the Rust Yards and gather up old power units. Fa'athra's men are wasteful--there ought to be plenty lying around.
But you need to recharge the power units at the energy station before you bring them back here. Got it?
Grab the power units, hit the energy station, come back here. Got it.
Sounds straightforward to me.
This may be impossible.
Try not to starve to death while I'm gone.
Just let me work.
Please hurry back.
Sorry, but I'm too busy to go scavenging for you.
No thanks. [Refuse quest]
Told you, Ezra. You were just wasting your breath.
Thanks for hearing me out, stranger. We'll find another way.
We've got all the trouble we need, stranger. Not looking for any more.
